timeline.message:
Create bulkRename method in VolumeManager

* Refactor fate code in BulkImportMove and MoveExportedFiles to call the
new method for handling renames of lots of files

timeline.author: keith-turner

replies.bodyText: My plan was to preserve current behavior of both methods.  Making this throw an exception would change the behavior where one file failing to rename fails the whole operation.
replies.author: milleruntime

replies.bodyText: The code that handles the futures deals with execution exceptions and false returns.  Could possibly make this simpler and not return anything Future<Void> and only deal with execution exceptions.
replies.author: keith-turner

replies.bodyText: This does seem to simplify things some.  You still suggesting we throw an error here when !success?
replies.author: milleruntime

replies.bodyText:
I took a quick look at the code calling bulk rename and I think it always fails if any of the futures fail.   I was wondering if it would make sense to move the future handling inside bulk rename and just have bulkRename throw an IOE if any future fails.  As long as this can still result in good error messages to users, I think may simplify the code calling bulk rename alot.

This does seem to simplify things some. You still suggesting we throw an error here when !success?

Moving the handling of futures into the same method makes this less of an issue because there is only one place to get it right (if a boolean and exception need to be checked).
replies.author: keith-turner

replies.bodyText: This did seem to clean up the handling in the FATE methods.  Checkout my latest, I think this is ready to go now.
replies.author: milleruntime

timeline.bodyText: A lambda within a lambda. I was looking for a way to add a third inner lambda, but did not see an opportunity.
timeline.author: keith-turner

timeline.bodyText: If this method is going to shutdown the pool, I think it would be better if it created the pool also.  This method could accept a number of threads and operation name instead of a thread pool and use those to create the pool.
timeline.author: keith-turner

replies.bodyText: That makes more sense to isolate the pool.  I will make that change.
replies.author: milleruntime

timeline.bodyText: I wonder if this check should also be done in the case where rename returns false.
timeline.author: keith-turner

replies.bodyText: In that case would we throw a new IOException?
replies.author: milleruntime

replies.bodyText: I decided since we are already logging an error per file when rename returns false, we should not also throw a new error, failing the transation.  It seems like this is just to rethrow any errors we may care about.
replies.author: milleruntime

timeline.message: Move handling of futures into VolumeManagerImpl method

timeline.author: keith-turner

timeline.bodyText: could add something to the docs about this operation being idempotent, safe to call again after previous partial run of bulkRename
